currentDoc:
Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, animals, particularly pets, are helpless. Compared to a human that can use their mind to assess the best action while being beaten, an animial can not easily escape a raging human. Animals can not do wrong in a moral sense. Humans, on the other hand, are flawed. 


Any steps to reduce suffering, either human or nonhuman, should be taken. It is wrong





Although this does not make it right, it is less surprising that humans can show a greater level of empathy toward their pets. I think it is wrong to have a disparity in the amount of concern for a suffering animal or person.

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, animals, particularly pets, are helpless. Compared to a human that can use their mind to assess the best action while being beaten, an animial can not easily escape a raging human. Animals can not do wrong in a moral sense. Humans, on the other hand, are flawed. 


Any steps to reduce suffering, either human or nonhuman, should be taken. It is wrong to beat an living being. 



Although this does not make it right, it is less surprising that humans can show a greater level of empathy toward their pets. I think it is wrong to have a disparity in the amount of concern for a suffering animal or person.

Although this does not make it right, it is less surprising that humans can show a greater level of empathy toward their pets. I think it is wrong to have a disparity in the amount of concern for a suffering animal or person.

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Although this does not make it right, it is less surprising that humans can show a greater level of empathy toward their pets. I think it is wrong to have a disparity in the amount of concern for a suffering animal or person.

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, animals, particularly pets, are helpless. Compared to a human that can use their mind to assess the best action while being beaten, an animial can not easily escape a raging human. Animals can not do wrong in a moral sense. Humans, on the other hand, are flawed. 

People may beat other people and animals because they believe the beating wilAny steps to reduce suffering, either human or nonhuman, should be taken. It is wrong to beat an living being. 



Although this does not make it right, it is less surprising that humans can show a greater level of empathy toward their pets. I think it is wrong to have a disparity in the amount of concern for a suffering animal or person.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, animals, particularly pets, are helpless. Compared to a human that can use their mind to assess the best action while being beaten, an animial can not easily escape a raging human. Animals can not do wrong in a moral sense. Humans, on the other hand, are flawed. 

People may beat other people and animals because they believe the beating will make the person change, or Any steps to reduce suffering, either human or nonhuman, should be taken. It is wrong to beat an living being. 



Although this does not make it right, it is less surprising that humans can show a greater level of empathy toward their pets. I think it is wrong to have a disparity in the amount of concern for a suffering animal or person.

People may beat other people and animals because they believe the beating will make the person change, or because they are angry.  TheAny steps to reduce suffering, either human or nonhuman, should be taken. It is wrong to beat an living being. 



Although this does not make it right, it is less surprising that humans can show a greater level of empathy toward their pets. I think it is wrong to have a disparity in the amount of concern for a suffering animal or person.

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Although this does not make it right, it is less surprising that humans can show a greater level of empathy toward their pets. I think it is wrong to have a disparity in the amount of concern for a suffering animal or person.

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

People may beat other people and animals because they believe the beating will make the person change, or because they are angry.  There is, however, no reason ever, to harm either man or beAny steps to reduce suffering, either human or nonhuman, should be taken. It is wrong to beat an living being. 



Although this does not make it right, it is less surprising that humans can show a greater level of empathy toward their pets. I think it is wrong to have a disparity in the amount of concern for a suffering animal or person.

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, animals, particularly pets, are helpless. Compared to a human that can use their mind to assess the best action while being beaten, an animial can not easily escape a raging human. Animals can not do wrong in a moral sense. Humans, on the other hand, are flawed. 

People may beat other people and animals because they believe the beating will make the person change, or because they are angry.  There is, however, no reason ever, to harm either man or beast.  On the contrary, any steps to reduce suffering, whether human or nonhuman, should be taken. It is wrong to beat a living being. In fact, in America, this is referred to as assault and is aga



Although this does not make it right, it is less surprising that humans can show a greater level of empathy toward their pets. I think it is wrong to have a disparity in the amount of concern for a suffering animal or person.

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

On the contrary, any steps to reduce suffering, whether human or nonhuman, should be taken. It is wrong to beat a living being. In fact, in America, this is referred to as assault and is against the law. The assailant can be fined and jailed.  So, hurthing others i



Although this does not make it right, it is less surprising that humans can show a greater level of empathy toward their pets. I think it is wrong to have a disparity in the amount of concern for a suffering animal or person.

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, animals, particularly pets, are helpless. Compared to a human that can use their mind to assess the best action while being beaten, an animial can not easily escape a raging human. Animals can not do wrong in a moral sense. Humans, on the other hand, are flawed. 

People may beat other people and animals because they believe the beating will make the person change, or because they are angry.  There is, however, no reason ever, to harm either man or beast.  On the contrary, any steps to reduce suffering, whether human or nonhuman, should be taken. It is wrong to beat a living being. In fact, in America, this is referred to as assault and is against the law. The assailant can be fined and jailed.  So, hurting others is both lawless and immoral. 


Although this does not make it right, it is less surprising that humans can show a greater lI think it is wrong to have a disparity in the amount of concern for a suffering animal or person.

People may beat other people and animals because they believe the beating will make the person change, or because they are angry.  There is, however, no reason ever, to harm either man or beast.  On the contrary, any steps to reduce suffering, whether human or nonhuman, should be taken. It is wrong to beat a living being. In fact, in America, this is referred to as assault and is against the law. The assailant can be fined and jailed.  So, hurting others is both lawless and immoral. 


Although this does not make it right, it is less surprising that humaI think it is wrong to have a disparity in the amount of concern for a suffering animal or person.

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

In my opinion, animals, particularly pets, are helpless. Compared to a human that can use their mind to assess the best action while being beaten, an animial can not easily escape a raging human. Animals can not do wrong in a moral sense. Humans, on the other hand, are flawed. 

People may beat other people and animals because they believe the beating will make the person change, or because they are angry.  There is, however, no reason ever, to harm either man or beast.  On the contrary, any steps to reduce suffering, whether human or nonhuman, should be taken. It is wrong to beat a living being. In fact, in America, this is referred to as assault and is against the law. The assailant can be fined and jailed.  So, hurting others is both lawless and immoral. 


Although this does not make it right, it is lI think it is wrong to have a disparity in the amount of concern for a suffering animal or person.

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

People may beat other people and animals because they believe the beating will make the person change, or because they are angry.  There is, however, no reason ever, to harm either man or beast.  On the contrary, any steps to reduce suffering, whether human or nonhuman, should be taken. It is wrong to beat a living being. In fact, in America, this is referred to as assault and is against the law. The assailant can be fined and jailed.  So, hurting others is both lawless and immoral. 


Although this does noI think it is wrong to have a disparity in the amount of concern for a suffering animal or person.

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, animals, particularly pets, are helpless. Compared to a human that can use their mind to assess the best action while being beaten, an animial can not easily escape a raging human. Animals can not do wrong in a moral sense. Humans, on the other hand, are flawed. 

People may beat other people and animals because they believe the beating will make the person change, or because they are angry.  There is, however, no reason ever, to harm either man or beast.  On the contrary, any steps to reduce suffering, whether human or nonhuman, should be taken. It is wrong to beat a living being. In fact, in America, this is referred to as assault and is against the law. The assailant can be fined and jailed.  So, hurting others is both lawless and immoral. 

I think it is wroto have a disparity in the amount of concern for a suffering animal or person.

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, animals, particularly pets, are helpless. Compared to a human that can use their mind to assess the best action while being beaten, an animial can not easily escape a raging human. Animals can not do wrong in a moral sense. Humans, on the other hand, are flawed. 

People may beat other people and animals because they believe the beating will make the person change, or because they are angry.  There is, however, no reason ever, to harm either man or beast.  On the contrary, any steps to reduce suffering, whether human or nonhuman, should be taken. It is wrong to beat a living being. In fact, in America, this is referred to as assault and is against the law. The assailant can be fined and jailed.  So, hurting others is both lawless and immoral. 

I think it is normal to have a disparity in the amount of concern for a suffering animal or person.  It would be wrong if a person chose

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

In my opinion, animals, particularly pets, are helpless. Compared to a human that can use their mind to assess the best action while being beaten, an animial can not easily escape a raging human. Animals can not do wrong in a moral sense. Humans, on the other hand, are flawed. 

People may beat other people and animals because they believe the beating will make the person change, or because they are angry.  There is, however, no reason ever, to harm either man or beast.  On the contrary, any steps to reduce suffering, whether human or nonhuman, should be taken. It is wrong to beat a living being. In fact, in America, this is referred to as assault and is against the law. The assailant can be fined and jailed.  So, hurting others is both lawless and immoral. 

I think it is normal to have a disparity in the amount of concern for a suffering animal or person.  It would be wrong if a person chose to save an animal over a human. People are hi

People may beat other people and animals because they believe the beating will make the person change, or because they are angry.  There is, however, no reason ever, to harm either man or beast.  On the contrary, any steps to reduce suffering, whether human or nonhuman, should be taken. It is wrong to beat a living being. In fact, in America, this is referred to as assault and is against the law. The assailant can be fined and jailed.  So, hurting others is both lawless and immoral. 

I think it is normal to have a disparity in the amount of concern for a suffering animal or person.  It would be wrong if a person chose to save an animal over a human. People are higher beings, spirituqal

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

People may beat other people and animals because they believe the beating will make the person change, or because they are angry.  There is, however, no reason ever, to harm either man or beast.  On the contrary, any steps to reduce suffering, whether human or nonhuman, should be taken. It is wrong to beat a living being. In fact, in America, this is referred to as assault and is against the law. The assailant can be fined and jailed.  So, hurting others is both lawless and immoral. 

I think it is normal to have a disparity in the amount of concern for a suffering animal or person.  It would be wrong if a person chose to save an animal over a human. People are higher beings, spiritually. Pe

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

In my opinion, animals, particularly pets, are helpless. Compared to a human that can use their mind to assess the best action while being beaten, an animial can not easily escape a raging human. Animals can not do wrong in a moral sense. Humans, on the other hand, are flawed. 

People may beat other people and animals because they believe the beating will make the person change, or because they are angry.  There is, however, no reason ever, to harm either man or beast.  On the contrary, any steps to reduce suffering, whether human or nonhuman, should be taken. It is wrong to beat a living being. In fact, in America, this is referred to as assault and is against the law. The assailant can be fined and jailed.  So, hurting others is both lawless and immoral.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, animals, particularly pets, are helpless. Compared to a human that can use their mind to assess the best action while being beaten, an animial can not easily escape a raging human. Animals can not do wrong in a moral sense. Humans, on the other hand, are flawed. 

People may beat other people and animals because they believe the beating will make the person change, or because they are angry.  There is, however, no reason ever, to harm either man or beast.  On the contrary, any steps to reduce suffering, whether human or nonhuman, should be taken. It is wrong to beat a living being. In fact, in America, this is referred to as assault and is against the law. The assailant can be fined and jailed.  So, hurting others is both lawless and immoral. 

I think it is normal to have a disparity in the amount of concern for a suffering animal or person.  It would be wrong if a person chose to save an animal over a human. Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, animals, particularly pets, are helpless. Compared to a human that can use their mind to assess the best action while being beaten, an animial can not easily escape a raging human. Animals can not do wrong in a moral sense. Humans, on the other hand, are flawed. 

People may beat other people and animals because they believe the beating will make the person change, or because they are angry.  There is, however, no reason ever, to harm either man or beast.  On the contrary, any steps to reduce suffering, whether human or nonhuman, should be taken. It is wrong to beat a living being. In fact, in America, this is referred to as assault and is against the law. The assailant can be fined and jailed.  So, hurting others is both lawless and immoral. 

I think it is normal to have a disparity in the amount of concern for a suffering animal or person.  It would be wrong if a person chose to save an animal over a human. People are higher beings, spiritually.  They are higher on the food chain and the moral chain, if there is such a thing.  Animals and humans are not equals.

On the contrary, any steps to reduce suffering, whether human or nonhuman, should be taken. It is wrong to beat a living being. In fact, in America, this is referred to as assault and is against the law. The assailant can be fined and jailed.  So, hurting others is both lawless and immoral. 

I think it is normal to have a disparity in the amount of concern for a suffering animal or person.  It would be wrong if a person chose to save an animal over a human. People are higher beings, spiritually.  They are higher on the food chain and the moral chain, if there is such a thing.  Animals and humans are not equals.

Ultimately, doing deliberat

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, animals, particularly pets, are helpless. Compared to a human that can use their mind to assess the best action while being beaten, an animial can not easily escape a raging human. Animals can not do wrong in a moral sense. Humans, on the other hand, are flawed. 

People may beat other people and animals because they believe the beating will make the person change, or because they are angry.  There is, however, no reason ever, to harm either man or beast.  On the contrary, any steps to reduce suffering, whether human or nonhuman, should be taken. It is wrong to beat a living being. In fact, in America, this is referred to as assault and is against the law. The assailant can be fined and jailed.  So, hurting others is both lawless and immoral. 

I think it is normal to have a disparity in the amount of concern for a suffering animal or person.  It would be wrong if a person chose to save an animal over a human. People are higher beings, spiritually.  They are higher on the food chain and the moral chain, if there is such a thing.  Animals and humans are not equals.

Ultimately, doing deliberate harm is wrong and unnece

People may beat other people and animals because they believe the beating will make the person change, or because they are angry.  There is, however, no reason ever, to harm either man or beast.  On the contrary, any steps to reduce suffering, whether human or nonhuman, should be taken. It is wrong to beat a living being. In fact, in America, this is referred to as assault and is against the law. The assailant can be fined and jailed.  So, hurting others is both lawless and immoral. 

I think it is normal to have a disparity in the amount of concern for a suffering animal or person.  It would be wrong if a person chose to save an animal over a human. People are higher beings, spiritually.  They are higher on the food chain and the moral chain, if there is such a thing.  Animals and humans are not equals.

Ultimately, doing deliberate harm is wrong and unnecessary. I do not believe i

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?
